column4: can anyone help me I'm trying to change the owner of my folder
have a look at using chmod
tried that
chmod 777 folderName *
woops i meant 'chown'
whats chown - do I write it chown folderName?
in the terminal try this for lots of info : man chown
its short for change owner
ok so I went into my folder and typed: chown webfarmer:webfarmer
$chown user:group target
says - bash command not found
have a read of this : https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FilePermissions
okay so how do I use this chown thing:"chown webfarmer webfarmer" inside a folder?
ok for example your in a folder called stuff...
and you want to make it owned by yourself...but its currently owned by root. or some other user like the webserver (www-data)
one sec verifying the command i'll give you
yea\
ok you would make that folder called stuff yours by using this (providing your currently inside it) : sudo chown webfarmer:webfarmer ./
but lets say there is files and folders already inside it owned by the www-data user....
you can recursively take ownership with : sudo chown webfarmer:webfarmer ./ -r
so i have been corrected that the recursive switch is -R not -r
but honestly on a live webserver, you wouldnt change ownership of the webserver files...instead you would insert yourself in to the www-data user group
